I'm able to create a data set from a 3.2M4 deployment environment.
One of the previous comments made was that: "In some platform, this instance can
not be successfully created.".

What are those "some platform" that this problem is seen in?

The error is related to the use of ICU4J, as shown in the stack.  Please make sure that whatever environment this is testing on has the correct version of the com.ibm.icu_3.4.2.jar installed.

Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException

         at com.ibm.icu.util.TimeZone.getDefault(TimeZone.java:697)
         at
com.ibm.icu.text.SimpleDateFormat.initialize(SimpleDateFormat.java:466)
         at com.ibm.icu.text.SimpleDateFormat.<init>(SimpleDateFormat.java:335)
         at com.ibm.icu.text.SimpleDateFormat.<init>(SimpleDateFormat.java:310)
         at
org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.oda.util.logging.LogManager.<clinit>(LogManager.java:323)

Add below code at the begining of previous comments.

import com.ibm.icu.text.SimpleDateFormat;

I'd tried to run similar test Java application in my WinXP platform, but did not get any error in either Chinese (PRC) or English(US) as the default system locale.

Also tried to search for related info from ICU web sites, and did not find any related references.  I figure that since such configuration should be fairly common, ICU web sites would have mentioned related issues if this were an ICU4J bug.
http://icu.sourceforge.net/
http://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/icu-support

In any case, do you see such problem when testing on English(US) default locale?

BTW, my testing sets system default locale by going to the "Advanced" tab in the Windows XP's Regional and Language Options, and set the "Language for non Unicode programs" to "Chinese(PRC)".
Linda, we repoduced this issue in both Chinese (PRC) and English(US) as the default system locale.

Temporarily rollback ICU4J implementation in ODA source...
so that the BIRT smoke tests are not blocked, and there can be more time to investigate the difference in systems configuration from mine, where the problem cannot be reproduced.

It seems that com.ibm.icu.util.TimeZone.getDefault( ) method has a bug in xp environment. When I use timezone GMT +8(China) or GMT -5(US) they null pointer exception would always be thrown. But if I set the timezone to GMT(Greenwich Mean Time, London) everything works fine. (We can change the timezone currently in use through control panel).

In windows 2000 environment, the method works smoothly, however.

Re-committed ICU4J implementation in ODA plugins.

Per comments from the ICU team in #127582:
"the ICU4J fix has been made and is scheduled for ICU4J 3.4.3, which
should be released in a week or so.  That should be in time to go into Eclipse
3.2M6."

A temporary work-around for those WindowsXP platforms that return an offset-based time zone style id, is to configure the Windows time zone to ?GMT?, and set the time according to local time.
